title: Patch Chat 6.11 - Better Nerf Irelia
body:
Hey all,

Welcome back to Patch Chat! We’re Riot’s Playtest Team, a group of high ranking League players whose job it is to play the hell out of things (lane tests, competitive testing, etc) and give actionable, objective feedback to designers.

Every two weeks (concurrent with the release of patch notes), we’re going to be hosting a discussion here on the state of balance on the current patch. **Take this opportunity to ask us any questions about the state of the game.** As Trinity Force is getting changed in [Patch 6.11](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-611-notes) to build out of Stinger and Zeal, we're especially interested in the impact this will have on its purchasers.

Patch Chat has been running for several patches now, but we’re still iterating on the format. With two new members starting in the last few weeks, we’re taking the opportunity to introduce ourselves and ask for any feedback about the format of Patch Chat. What do you like about Patch Chat or wish to see in the future? What do you hate? Do you have a favorite playtester?

**Adam "_Afic_" Cohen**
I used to lead a competitive raiding guild in vanilla WoW (Nightmare’s Asylum).

**Ben “_Cezium_” Burkhardt**
I worked for NASA writing scripts that automated telescope function to assist in the discovery of new asteroids.

**Shawn “_I Am The IRS_” Currie**
I’m a rock climbing enthusiast who’s slowly converting Playtest into a team of climbers. So far Ben, Mattias, Blake and Trevor are all in on it!

**Miles “_Daydreamin_” Hoard**
I really like to climb trees.

**Bao “_Bao_” Lam**
I didn’t find out that I was Chinese until I was in college! I grew up speaking Vietnamese and doing all Vietnamese culture stuff so I just figured I was full Vietnamese.

**Mattias “_Gentleman Gustaf_” Lehman**
I take glee in being fancy. It’s especially funny at a computer game company, which is a pretty casual environment. There’s something about getting compliments all day - especially from people I don’t know - that just perks me up and motivates me.

**Nicholas “_Nickwu_” Smith**
My favorite animated movie is Tangled. It was awesome.

**Nicholas “_Gleeb_” Haddad**
I’ve played in the LCS for two different teams.

**Blake “_Sobe_” Soberanis**
I’m a huge caffeine addict. One time I had four 5-hour energy drinks in a 30 minute period during a tournament… that was a disaster. With that much caffeine it becomes impossible to concentrate and I was shaking like crazy. Didn’t sleep for a couple days. 0/10 would not recommend.

**Trevor “_ThEntropist_” Thernes**
While in high school I ran a Youtube channel of me doing card tricks to pay for all of my high school needs. Maybe I’ll be Twisted Fate for Halloween one of these years.

Previous I remember someone mention that during testing, nerfing zed's q makes zed weak. What changed?

That's me. I was also the one who fought really hard for the Zed nerfs that are in the patch notes. 

If you go back and read what I wrote, the reason nerfing Zed's Q is such a big deal is because it hits his waveclear and poke and farming and all ins. With the current change list we are hitting some of those while also maintaining some by giving him more damage if he hits multiple shurikens. So we are not just flat nerfing his q overall, we are buffing it in other places to compensate.

>So we are not just flat nerfing his q overall, we are buffing it in other places to compensate.

This feels a lot like favouritism to me and a lot of the community though. 

When you nerf other champions you don't give them the same considerations, for example Sej. You nerfed her W % HP damage from 12% to 6% and nerfed her slow when missing an ult from 90% to 30%, no compensation buffs. This isn't just something that you've stopped doing since then either, because you did the exact same to Azir in the last patch.

So why the favouritism towards Zed? Why is he the only champion who gets such careful consideration? Why doesn't he get some ["time out of the spotlight"](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/vWEoZ6X0-balance-team-qa-ask-us-anything?comment=00440000)?

I very much doubt the changes will make Azir super weak, as for that "time out of the spotlight comment" is probably one of the dumbest things said by Rioters, if you've read the other comments most don't agree with him. 

As for the Zed nerf a direct quote from the play testers on their stream Wednesday was basically "Zed wasn't really strong and really didn't deserve nerfs, the only reason we did was because of all the complaints"

How so? I would take Mercury's Treads over them any day. 25% less slowing effect, situational, or 30% less duration for all cc? I will take the -15 movement speed hit for that.
Considering how many champs have a lot of slows built into their kit plus the still high popularity of IGB means it is still extremely easy for your mobility to be affected by non hard CC.
You do realize mercury treads reduce all cc INCLUDING slows right? The only upside of swifties is 15 more movement speed, the 25% less slows is subpar in every way to mercs 30% less cc.
actually it only reduced the duration of CC, not the effect of them.

There's an important point about the difference between slows and other CCs to be made here.

Slows have two numbers; a degree and a duration. Other CCs, on the other hand, only have a duration.

CC reduction reduces the **duration **of CCs, so you can avoid being perma-CC'd. Slows are relatively spammable (red buff or Ashe Frost Shot or IBG are pretty clear examples), so reducing the **duration ** of a slow often does little for you. Reducing the amount of the slow, on the other hand, can allow you to get onto that pesky ranged kiter (and most melee champions have ways to stick once they're on their target).

While sometimes they fulfill the same purpose, the two types of CC reduction are pretty distinct.

Good to see you around, Gustaf.

Any word on Syndra bug fixes? Nothing has been mentioned even with a few champion breaking bugs being introduced after MYMU. 

What are your thoughts on the balance of Syndra? I know win rate is not indicative but she's sitting at one of the lowest: 45%.

No word that I know of bug fixes. Do you have any bugs that you can reproduce? I'd be happy to pass those along to the designer, but most of the struggle in bugs is finding what causes them. 

I also believe Syndra is on the radar for being a bit weak. No promises on if she will get changes, but I do know she is at least being looked at.

Her ultimate literally does not pick up spheres manipulated by her Q/W/E for several seconds. It's costing her enormous amounts of kill potential. It was reported back in mid patch 6.9.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tk7FVu3c3Ao

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AZWjyXt3LNA

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aND9G80RSK0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j-SyEuYHSVI

Not to mention the W break bug (it goes on cooldown when she's CC'd in the pull animation), or the E knockback not stunning/knocking back (again), or the fact whenever she uses her ultimate she *physically desyncs from the game world and wrecks locked camera players*. That desync one has been there for 2 years now.

She's got a lot of bugs that just sit around, so :)

Edit; here's a playlist https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL6o_Jh1Wm2f54JKXGW6zJwe5r4t4mawU4

I know how to reproduce some of the bugs but I don't have any way to record for evidence.

- Syndra's ult doesn't pick up all the spheres sometimes. So if you've set up a 7 sphere ult, it can become a 3 sphere ult. This is affected by Q/W/E manipulated spheres. Syndra loses over 50% of her burst.
- If Syndra uses Force of Will and is CC'd whilst holding sphere(s), then you can't reactivate. 
- Movement animation. Syndra creep blocks (for the lack of a better term) herself.
- When you Q/E combo, the E cone hitbox is pushing the enemy away at very strange angles causing the stun to miss even though you aim it head on. Also, there are still instances of knockback and stun not working although a lot rarer than in early Season 5.
- Syndra, after ulting, stutters across the screen for several seconds. It can be difficult to control yourself during this.

These are the main bugs I've encountered. Syndra's death animation, recall is bugged too.

That's good to know that's Syndra is being looked at since she has received little to no attention since MYMU.

What are your thoughts on maybe not a majority agreed point but logically agreed on by many that part of tanks oppressiveness comes from too much of everything. Most have readily available CC with a few having hard CC in their regular skills, all have massive amounts of self sustain, all the best ones have %health/increase damage based off tank stats(armor/health)/straight free damage increase. Really the only thing that they don't have is that they aren't ranged type champs.

I actually don't agree. If those champions didn't have % health damage, they'd need higher base damage (or I guess more CC) to ever damage other tanks (and thus avoid noodle fights). % Health damage allows tanks to hurt each other without upping their damage against carries.

at the same time, Poppy does 14% max hp damage per Q (assuming they stay in, which they're usually forced to). A Q that's on a low CD. I do agree % hp damage has a purpose, but, as you guys said a while back, poppy has loads of everything a tank could want, including damage.

Part of the issue is the fact that they are tanks, they are meant to survive a long time, to the point that they are generally hard counters to carries as a whole. In a fight of a tank vs a carry, the tank would likely engage+cc+%health damage for their initiate, and in the process of that fight they will still be putting out heavy damage from either base damage or their kits scaling with tank stats, and they WILL survive long enough to repeat their initiation meaning the squishy will be definitely killed in that time. And on top of all tank, CC utility, and damage, many tanks have very strong built in sustain further exaggerating the issue of their tankiness.

So % health may be good in the tank vs tank, but on tanks vs everyone else it makes tanks too good at too much.

You guys considering doing anything to look into Veigar's power and rate of scaling since the mage update?

It's not just his scaling that makes him so annoying.  It just feels like there's no "right" way to lane against him.  If you make it a farm lane, he gets tons of AP from minions.  If you try to do short trades to eventually poke him out of lane, he gets AP from hitting you back.  If you go all in, you get stuck in his cage and either intentionally get stunned (then hit by his W) or sit in there while their jungler makes his way over.

It just feels like whatever choice you make benefits Veigar in some way.  The only way around it is with assassins or super long range champions who can poke without retaliation.

I'm not saying he's op necessarily, just that it feels bad playing against him regardless of the choices you make.

the other option is a competent jungle.
